result.execSummary:
The defendant Charleston Joseph Klug was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with D.R. directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
Defendant to obtain a High School Diploma, GED or HSED during the pendency of probation term.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is eligible for Huber. Defendant is not eligible for Good Time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same conditions as listed for Count 1 with the exception of the Jail Time.
Same repayment terms as noted for Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charleston Joseph Klug

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:00 PM Defendant Charleston Joseph Klug in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court for Charleston Joseph Klug. The Court entertains wavier of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Counts 1 & 2 - NC. Repeater enhancers dismissed. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Counts 3 & 4 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Leusink. Sentencing argument by Atty Zamzow. Statement by the DE. Court orders: S/W - 4 years probation. Conditions: As to Count 1 only: 276 days WC Jail, Huber, No GT credit. 127 days CFTS. As to both counts: AODA and follow through. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with D.R. directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party. Defendant to obtain a High School Diploma, GED or HSED during the pendency of probation term. Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Dennis J Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow appeared by phone for Charleston Joseph Klug. Atty Zamzow is requesting a P/S hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Case called @ 3:49 PM Defendant Charleston Joseph Klug appeared in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Attorney Wesley Kottke appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. Motion by Atty Zamzow for modification of bond. The Court respectfully declines bond modification. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.
Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on April 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

1:22 PM Defendant Charleston Joseph Klug appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Emma Blankschein.  Attorney Wes Kottke appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint stated. Attorney Blankschein confirms receipt. Defendant is eligible for SPD representation. Bond arguments by counsel. Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. Court orders $2500 cash bond w/conditions.
Initial appearance scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 03:46 pm.
